summary: Americans rely on the Global Positioning System daily. DOD is working to modernize GPS and deliver a more secure signal to military users, an effort that has taken longer than planned and cost more than expected. DOD faces risks as it simultaneously develops satellites, a ground system to operate them, and receiver cards that allow use of GPS signals. It will need to install receiver...
title: Global Positioning System: Better Planning and Coordination Needed to Improve Prospects for Fielding Modernized Capability
